intro: Juniperus chinensis var. variegata, commonly known as the Variegated Chinese Juniper, is a compact, slow-growing evergreen shrub or small tree native to China. It features distinctive foliage with variegated leaves that display shades of yellow, white, and green, creating a striking visual contrast. The plant produces small, blue-black berries that are typically bird-dispersed, contributing to its ecological role. It is highly adaptable to various soil types and can thrive in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes for its aesthetic appeal and hardiness.
